title: Shri Manjalpur Mahila Audyogik Sahakari Mandli Ltd
detailsOfAchievement: Our society is dedicated towards the Artisans of the country. The prime requirement of the rural Artisans is to unite and form a business oriented group. That entails them to move ahead, negotiate and chalk out future plan on their own terms. In old days, formation of such guilds was very normal and allowed our Artisan and their art to grow. However with passage of time, the culture of the guild disappeared from our country, rendering the Artisans alone and helpless. This is where our society is contributing. We organize the Artisans in to community based enterprises like SHG or COOPs etc. Thus we make them in to a group of active entrepreneurs and primary stakeholders in the process of development. Our activity can be further summarized as under â€“1) Regularly organize the training programs for our artisans. Educate them in to new technics, new designs and the latest market trend. The purpose is to bring them at par with the market-trend. We also invite the faculties from various fields , many a times with active support from the govt bodies, so that our artisans can interact freely. 2) We fully understand that, focusing only on the commercial part is not sufficient. Hence ,we also consider the social and familial structure of our villages. Thus we specially organize the training modules for our women artisans. Not only we cover the technical issues, but we specifically cover the issues related to literacy & girl child, sanitation, child upbringing and introducing the basics of finance/banking. 3) Supporting our artisans to market their products is the most crucial part of our entire activity. If our trained Artisans are not able to find a customer, then the whole purpose of the activity is defeated. We organize the marketing events for our artisans on national level. Thus we bridge the gap between our artisans and the potential customer. These events are well planned and artisans are informed in advance about schedule. We strive to have maximum participation. Thus our society is in an active supportive role, in every stage of development. From initial training up to marketing, we take care of our artisans at every step. organised gandhi shilp bazar and craft bazar at mumbai and ghandhidham and bhuj for marketing platform to the artisans under dch scheme. organised training program for embroidery, jari jardoshi, agate stone, mirrory embroidery under dch scheme. total 220 artisans get training

detailsOfAchievement: Shroffs Foundation Trust was instituted in 1980 as a result of philanthropic endeavor of Shroff family, leading industrialists from Gujarat. The trust has been actively working in tribal area of Chhota Udepur since 1995 and has implemented various developmental programs related to water and soil conservation, agriculture improvement, health, education, literacy, handicraft development, animal husbandry and various income generation activities in about 1058 villages in Vadodara district and Banni area in Kutch district in Gujarat To achieve its goal of providing self-supporting development benefits in the tribal area, the trust operates out of four centers, Rangpur and Pavijetpur in Chhota Udepur, Ekalbara in Padra in Vadodara district and Banni in Kutch district of Gujarat with its head quarters at Kalali, Vadodara. The trust also believes in institution building and cooperative development. 24 bedded Ramkrishna Paramhans Hospital at Kalali offers quality health services at affordable rate to poor and needy patients since 2004. Sanjeevani Dialysis Unit set up in 2009 with 4 Hemo-Dialysis machines offer dialysis at half the regular rate. Equipped with modern equipment, pathology laboratory, physiotherapy unit, a pharmacy, RKPH treats about 7,000 patients a year through specialists in various fields. Swami Vivekanand Krushi Seva Kendra established to cater to the needs of the farmers, provides technology, guidance and material inputs and supports them on day to day bases through helpline. The objective is to help farmers reduce the agro input cost and aim for higher yield and better quality output, strengthening market linkages to fetch better rates for their products. Since its inception in 1998, so far it has helped about 11,000 farmers. Vivekanand Institute for Self Help founded in 2003 has been training cross section of the society, especially those belonging to rural areas. It functions with the view to build capacities of all the stake holders to maximize the benefits of developmental projects undertaken, by GO/NGOs. So far it has trained about 10,000 people through about 400 training programs in various areas. Shroffs Foundation Trust (SFT) through its various health related projects like HIV, AIDS awareness has reached out to about 1,40,000 youth. It conducted District Situational Analysis in 128 villages of 13 blocks in Vadodara district to identify hot spot villages. Through RCH II program it has reached out to people of about 50 villages covering population of 37,000. SFT imparted capacity building training to 3400 women belonging to Matru Mandals at Anganwadi level in Kutch district. Under Literacy Campaign initiated in 2006, it has so far trained 4050 women. Under various Livelihood Security programs, 2784 women and 72 youth have been trained. Shardadevi Gramudhyog Co-op Society an outcome of SGSY project and Vivekanand Gobar Bank Co-op Society are the typical examples of cooperative movement for income generation.71 families have been provided cooking gas through Bio-gas plant. Safe drinking water has been provided in 147 villages and Water and Sanitation Management programs have been implemented in 61 villages. Rooftop rainwater harvesting was done in 20 schools in Kutch district. Year after year the trust is gaining new grounds through expansion of its infrastructure, covering new areas geographically and introducing much needed services to reach out to more and more people.
